cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 140 miles NW of San Juan, Puerto Rico
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing WNW, forecast to pass just north of Hispaniola, then across the Turks & Caicos/Bahamas and curve north-northwest toward south Florida before moving inland over the Florida peninsula and into Georgia/Alabama early next week.

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane watches confined to Cuba (Matanzas eastward) and the north-western Bahamas; none along the U.S. Gulf Coast.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane warnings in effect for Puerto Rico, Dominican Republic north coast, Haiti north coast, Turks & Caicos, and the southeastern-central Bahamas; none for the northern Gulf Coast.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Greatest impacts expected over the Bahamas, south & east Florida, and later the Georgia–South Carolina coast and interior southeast U.S.
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (3%) of tropical-storm-force winds; any gusts most likely Monday night into Tuesday and should remain below gale force.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Mississippi coast from Irma based on current forecast track.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands could bring 1–3 inches of rain late Monday into Tuesday.
